verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
Can a man<WH1397> be profitable<WH5532> to God,<WH410> as he that is wise<WH7919> may be profitable<WH5532> to himself?<WH5315>
Is it any pleasure<WH2656> to the Almighty,<WH7706> that you are righteous?<WH6663> or is it gain<WH1214> to him, that you make your ways<WH1870> perfect?<WH8552>
Will he reprove<WH3198> you for fear<WH3374> of you? will he enter<WH935> with you into judgment?<WH4941>
Is not your wickedness<WH7451> great?<WH7227> and your iniquities<WH5771> infinite?<WH369>
For you have taken<WH2254> a pledge<WH2254> from your brother<WH251> for nothing,<WH2600> and stripped<WH6584> the naked<WH6174> of their clothing.<WH899>
You have not given water<WH4325> to the weary<WH5889> to drink,<WH8248> and you have withheld<WH4513> bread<WH3899> from the hungry.<WH7456>
But as for the mighty<WH2220> man,<WH376> he had the earth;<WH776> and the honorable<WH5375> <WH6440> man dwelled<WH3427> in it.
You have sent<WH7971> widows<WH490> away empty,<WH7387> and the arms<WH2220> of the fatherless<WH3490> have been broken.<WH1792>
Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> snares<WH6341> are round<WH5439> about you, and sudden<WH6597> fear<WH6343> troubles<WH926> you;
Or<WH176> darkness,<WH2822> that you can not see;<WH7200> and abundance<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> cover<WH3680> you.
Is not God<WH433> in the height<WH1363> of heaven?<WH8064> and behold<WH7200> the height<WH7218> of the stars,<WH3556> how<WH3588> high<WH7311> they are!
And you say,<WH559> How<WH4100> does God<WH410> know?<WH3045> can he judge<WH8199> through the dark<WH6205> cloud?<WH6205>
Thick clouds<WH5645> are a covering<WH5643> to him, that he sees<WH7200> not; and he walks<WH1980> in the circuit<WH2329> of heaven.<WH8064>
Have you marked<WH8104> the old<WH5769> way<WH734> which<WH834> wicked<WH205> men<WH4962> have trodden?<WH1869>
Which<WH834> were cut<WH7059> down out of time,<WH6256> whose foundation<WH3247> was overflowed<WH3332> with a flood:<WH5104>
Which said<WH559> to God,<WH410> Depart<WH5493> from us: and what<WH4100> can the Almighty<WH7706> do<WH6466> for them?
Yet he filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with good<WH2896> things: but the counsel<WH6098> of the wicked<WH7563> is far<WH7350> from me.
The righteous<WH6662> see<WH7200> it, and are glad:<WH8056> and the innocent<WH5355> laugh<WH3932> them to scorn.
Whereas<WH518> our substance<WH7009> is not cut<WH3582> down, but the remnant<WH3499> of them the fire<WH784> consumes.<WH398>
Acquaint<WH5532> now<WH4994> yourself with him, and be at peace:<WH7999> thereby good<WH2896> shall come<WH935> to you.
Receive,<WH3947> I pray<WH4994> you, the law<WH8451> from his mouth,<WH6310> and lay<WH7760> up his words<WH561> in your heart.<WH3824>
If<WH518> you return<WH7725> to the Almighty,<WH7706> you shall be built<WH1129> up, you shall put away<WH7368> iniquity<WH5766> far<WH7350> from your tabernacles.<WH168>
Then shall you lay<WH7896> up gold<WH1220> as dust,<WH6083> and the gold of Ophir<WH211> as the stones<WH6697> of the brooks.<WH5158>
Yes, the Almighty<WH7706> shall be your defense,<WH1220> and you shall have plenty<WH8443> of silver.<WH3701>
For then<WH227> shall you have your delight<WH6026> in the Almighty,<WH7706> and shall lift<WH5375> up your face<WH6440> to God.<WH433>
You shall make your prayer<WH6279> to him, and he shall hear<WH8085> you, and you shall pay<WH7999> your vows.<WH5088>
You shall also decree<WH1504> a thing,<WH562> and it shall be established<WH6965> to you: and the light<WH216> shall shine<WH5050> on your ways.<WH1870>
When<WH3588> men are cast<WH8213> down,<WH8213> then you shall say,<WH559> There is lifting<WH1466> up; and he shall save<WH3467> the humble<WH7807> person.
He shall deliver<WH4422> the island<WH336> of the innocent:<WH5355> and it is delivered<WH4422> by the pureness<WH1252> of your hands.<WH3709>
